com.Cardinal.CommandPackage.Command

Interface ICommand

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISpecialAccesCommand
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHelpCommand, DefaultPrefixCommand, ManuallyProcessedCommand

    public interface ICommand
    An template for Discord bot commands.
    Author:
    Cardinal System
    See Also:
    CommandRegistry

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the command name. This is the name that will be matched with the command and used to invoke it. For example, if your command prefix is $, and your command name is ban, then the command will be invoked when a user types $ban .
        Returns:
        the command name.

      • getCategory

        ICategory getCategory()
        Gets this command's category. This method is generally used by help commands for sorting command lists.
        Returns:
        this command's category.
        See Also:
        DefaultCategories

      • getPermissions

        java.util.EnumSet<net.dv8tion.jda.api.Permission> getPermissions()
        Get's the permissions required for the bot to process this command. This is used to generate an invite link for the bot.
        Returns:
        an EnumSet of the required permissions to execute this command.
        See Also:
        PropertiesHandler.BOT_PERMISSIONS_PROPERTY

      • getArgumentTypes

        ArgumentTypes[] getArgumentTypes()
        Gets the argument types for the command parameters. If an argument is optional, use ArgumentTypes.optional(). If your command takes special arguments that cannot be processed by this library, then make sure to include ArgumentTypes.CUSTOM at the end of this array. If the command does not take any arguments, this method can return null.

        NOTE: ArgumentTypes.CUSTOM is not used for custom arguments. If you want your command to take a special/custom argument, then use ArgumentTypes.STRING, and parse the argument yourself in execute(MessageReceivedEvent, CommandRegistry, String, Object...).

        NOTE: If you use ArgumentTypes.CUSTOM, your command will not show any arguments on the default help command unless it extends ManuallyProcessedCommand.

        NOTE: Array and optional types must be the last arguments in the arguments array. Each command may only have one optional argument. Command may not have both array and optional arguments.
        Returns:
        the argument types, or null.

      • getArgumentNames

        java.lang.String[] getArgumentNames()
        Gets the name of each argument in order. This method is generally used for making help commands. It is also used when a user issues this command with the wrong arguments. If your command does not take any arguments, then this can return null.
        Returns:
        the argument names, or null.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the description of this command. This method is generally used for making help commands. If you do not have a help command, then this can return null.
        Returns:
        the command description, or null.

      • execute

        void execute(net.dv8tion.jda.api.events.message.MessageReceivedEvent event,
             CommandRegistry registry,
             java.lang.String prefix,
             java.lang.Object... arguments)
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes this command. getArgumentTypes() will be invoked on the command instance before this method is called. If it returns an array with at least one element, then the message which triggered the command will be processed into an array of objects such that each element will have the data type defined in the corresponding argument-types array, and will passed to this method upon invocation. In other words, you don't have to manually divide the message and parse the various arguments. All you to do is cast each element from the arguments array passed to this method.

        NOTE: It is highly discouraged to use Thread.sleep(long), Object.wait(), or any other form of blocking in this method. Threads which block longer than than the timeout specified in CommandClient.CommandClientBuilder.withThreadTimeout(long) will cause the WaitingEventHandler assigned to that event to execute.
        Parameters:
        event - the event that triggered this command. This is provided for commands that need more than just arguments to execute.
        registry - the command registry which this command is registered in. This parameter is generally used by help commands.
        prefix - The command prefix the guild which the event originated from.
        arguments - the user-provided arguments, or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any unhandled exceptions will be caught by the executor and handled properly.
